title: Example Enclosure Setups: Reference Builds
author: Habitat Builder Team
excerpt: A curated collection of reference enclosures to help you visualize layout, lighting, and decor choices.
description: Reference enclosure builds with photos, layout notes, and setup highlights. Use these examples to visualize your plan and refine your layout choices.

content.text: These reference builds are curated examples that show how a complete setup can look when the plan is applied in real life. Use them for layout inspiration, decor balance, and equipment placement. We will continue adding more examples over time.

content.heading: White's Tree Frog: Three Reference Builds

content.text: Each example below uses the same core care requirements but different styling priorities. The goal is to show how the same plan can be expressed as minimalist, naturalistic, or display-focused.

content.alt: White's Tree Frog minimalist enclosure setup
content.caption: Minimalist setup: clean layout, simple hides, and easy maintenance.

content.alt: White's Tree Frog naturalistic enclosure setup
content.caption: Naturalistic setup: live plants, leaf litter, and layered visual cover.

content.alt: White's Tree Frog display enclosure setup
content.caption: Display setup: premium hardscape and lighting for a showcase look.

items: Match the core care targets from your plan first, then customize the decor style.
Use the layout zones in your plan as anchors for basking, hides, and water areas.
Balance coverage and open space so the animal can move and thermoregulate.
Treat these as starting points, not strict templates.

content.text: More species examples are coming. If a species is missing, use the layout zones and build steps in your plan to build a safe baseline while we expand the gallery.
